Key Match Events: Lane Thomas and Josh Naylor each hit two-run homers for the Cleveland Guardians.
Gavin Williams pitched seven sharp innings for the Guardians.
Emmanuel Clase handled the ninth for his 41st save.
Pre-Game Insights: The Guardians began the day with a 3 1/2-game lead over Minnesota and Kansas City in the division.
Post-Match Reflections: The Royals finished with two hits in their season-high sixth consecutive loss.
Garcia said Williams threw more curveballs 'and we didnâ€™t make the adjustment.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Royals played without manager Matt Quatraro, who missed the game because of a personal matter.
Bobby Witt Jr. served as the designated hitter for the Royals, his first game away from shortstop since last Sept. 4, a span of 161 games.
Others: Royals 1B Yuli Gurriel left in the eighth because of right hamstring tightness.
The Guardians won for the fourth time in five games.
